articleBody: Learning Objectives â€¢ Understand the different styles of portrait photography and their unique characteristics. â€¢ Master the use of light, composition, and posing to create compelling portraits. â€¢ Develop technical skills in camera settings specific to portrait photography. Learn More & Join Download Assignment PDF Before You Shoot â€¢ Select a suitable location that complements the subject's personality and story. â€¢ Communicate with your subject to establish rapport and understand their preferences. â€¢ Choose the appropriate lens for the desired focal length and perspective. â€¢ Prepare your camera settings in advance based on the lighting conditions. â€¢ Gather any necessary props or accessories that may enhance the portrait. The Assignment Technical Focus â€¢ Use a wide aperture (f/1.8 to f/2.8) to create a shallow depth of field, isolating the subject from the background. â€¢ Set the shutter speed to at least 1/125s to avoid motion blur, especially in candid shots. â€¢ Adjust the ISO setting based on the lighting: use ISO 100-400 in bright conditions and ISO 800-1600 in lower light. â€¢ Utilize single-point autofocus to ensure precise focus on the subject's eyes. â€¢ Set the white balance according to the lighting conditions, such as daylight or cloudy, to achieve accurate skin tones. Creative Focus â€¢ Experiment with different angles and perspectives to find the most flattering view of your subject. â€¢ Incorporate environmental elements to tell a story about the subject's personality and lifestyle. â€¢ Use natural light during golden hour for soft, flattering illumination. â€¢ Encourage your subject to engage in natural movements or expressions to capture candid moments. â€¢ Explore different styles of posing to create dynamic and interesting compositions. Assignment Tasks â€¢ Capture a traditional portrait using a 50mm lens at f/2.8, 1/125s, ISO 200 in aperture priority mode, with the subject looking directly at the camera. â€¢ Shoot a lifestyle portrait in a park setting at f/4, 1/250s, ISO 400 in manual mode, allowing the subject to interact with their environment. â€¢ Create an environmental portrait using a 35mm lens at f/5.6, 1/60s, ISO 800, ensuring the background complements the subject's story. â€¢ Take a candid portrait at f/2.0, 1/500s, ISO 1600 in shutter priority mode, capturing the subject in a moment of laughter or thought. â€¢ Photograph a headshot at f/1.8, 1/125s, ISO 100 in portrait mode, focusing on the subject's eyes while blurring the background. â€¢ Experiment with backlighting by shooting at f/2.8, 1/200s, ISO 400 in manual mode, creating a halo effect around the subject. ðŸ’¡ Stretch Tasks â€¢ Create a series of portraits that explore different emotions, using varied lighting setups and compositions. â€¢ Conduct a portrait session with a focus on storytelling, incorporating props and environmental elements to enhance the narrative.
